section_purpose: To explain the modeling of 3-SAT problems as constraint satisfaction problems (CSP) and describe the experimental setup, including data generation, baseline methods, and evaluation protocol for the 3-SAT experiments.
key_points: Modeling a Boolean CNF formula as a CSP instance with Boolean variables (domain {0,1}) and constraints derived from clauses, where each constraint excludes the single unsatisfying assignment.

Training data consists of random uniform 3SAT instances with 100 variables and a clause/variable ratio between 4 and 5, near the satisfiability threshold; validation uses 200 variables with the same density.

Baseline methods include PDP (trained on the same distribution), RLSAT (trained with a curriculum learning sequence), WalkSAT (with tuned parameters but defaults used), and probSAT (default configuration).
Experimental setup involves running each method for 10,000 steps per instance, with 10 runs for non-deterministic methods and taking the best attempt as the output.

algorithms: Modeling of 3-SAT as CSP: variables correspond to Boolean variables with domain {0,1}, constraints correspond to clauses with relation R^C = {0,1}^k \ {t_c}, where k is clause arity and t_c is the unsatisfying assignment.
Baseline algorithms: PDP (trained on Ω_3SAT), RLSAT (trained with curriculum learning on increasing variable counts), WalkSAT (with parameter tuning), probSAT (default configuration).
formulas: Constraint relation for a clause: R^C = {0,1}^k \ {t_c}, where k is the arity of the clause and t_c ∈ {0,1}^k is the unsatisfying assignment combination.
datasets: Training distribution Ω_3SAT: random uniform 3SAT instances with 100 variables, clause/variable ratio uniformly sampled between 4 and 5.
Validation dataset: 3SAT instances with 200 variables and the same clause/variable ratio distribution.

dependencies: Understanding of CSP modeling from Preliminaries or earlier sections
Familiarity with baseline methods PDP, RLSAT, WalkSAT, probSAT from Related Work or previous experiment sections
Knowledge of experimental setup from section 5 Experiments or other parts of Appendix B
reproducibility_notes: Data generation parameters for training and validation: variable counts, clause/variable ratio distribution.
Baseline configurations: PDP default, RLSAT curriculum sequence, WalkSAT and probSAT default parameters.
Experimental protocol: 10,000 steps per instance, 10 runs per instance for non-deterministic methods, best attempt output for PDP only once.
Modeling details for converting 3-SAT to CSP instances.
